Deadline: April 15

Before completing the report:

  • Update the personal information on your Forum profile
  • Update your products*, including publications, awards, presentations, patents, etc., either manually or by uploading your CCV; be sure to assign each one to a GlycoNet project, if applicable (see “Managing Products” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Add any new members (trainees and collaborators) who are not already in the Forum (see “Managing People” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Edit the roles and relations of any trainees that you supervise (see “Managing People” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Add top research outcomes (found in the “Dashboard” tab on your project page)

To complete your section of the report:

  • Fill in all applicable sections of the Project Report:
    • Milestones (all)
    • Achievements
    • HQP
    • Networking
    • KTEE
    • Budget
    • Partner Contributions
  • Generate and preview project report PDF
  • Submit project report to GlycoNet Administrative Centre

*Managing numerous publications can be challenging for investigators. Therefore, it is highly recommended that this task be delegated to trainees as much as possible.

Need further assistance?

Please visit the “Forum Help and FAQs” page on the GlycoNet website (http://canadianglycomics.ca/forum-help-and-faqs/), or contact Ryan Snitynsky (snitynsk@ualberta.ca).

ReportSection.name: Partner Contributions
ReportSection.title: Partner Contributions

ReportItem.title: What are eligible contributions?
ReportItem.text:
Partner contributions may include:
  1. Cash contributions
  2. In-kind contributions
    • Equipment & software
    • Materials
    • Logistical support of fieldwork
    • Provision of services
    • Use of company facilities
    • Salaries of scientific staff
    • Salaries of managerial and administrative staff
    • Project related travel
    • Other
Do not include:
  • grants from federal granting agencies, such as NSERC, CIHR, SSHRC, CFI or Genome Canada and its provincial centres for research, equipment, etc.;
  • contributions from partners who are funded by federal granting agencies, such as NCE, NSERC, CIHR, SSHRC, CFI or Genome Canada.
  • salaries of individuals who are eligible to receive funds directly from the granting agencies (e.g. faculty members of postsecondary institutions) and any associated administrative overhead costs.
  • contributions or contracts outside of the scope of the network’s activities.
  • time on committees and boards.
